subject: p13881772
History: Intubated-year-old woman. Check Dobbhoff tube placement.
Impression: AP chest compared to : Feeding tube with a wire stylet in place ends in the lower esophagus and would need to be advanced at least 16 cm to move all the side ports into the stomach. Dr. Was paged as requested. Moderate bilateral pleural effusions and left lower lobe atelectasis have worsened. Upper lungs are clear. Heart size normal. No pneumothorax. Probe is unchanged in position at the gastroesophageal junction and a nasogastric drainage tube still ends in the upper esophagus. Right internal jugular line tip is low in the SVC. ET tube in standard placement. No pneumothorax.
